Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant is a Convention refugee with an objectively justified fear of persecution based on religion
Application_Facts: Applicant faced multiple incidents of harassment due to his Ahmadi faith but continued practicing his religion and studying
Decision_Outcome: Application dismissed; applicant remains ineligible for refugee status
Court_Ruling: The court upheld the Refugee Division's view that the incidents were isolated and did not constitute persecution
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution based on religion (Ahmadi faith)
Legal_Standard: To qualify as a refugee, the applicant must prove subjective fear and objective justification for persecution. Systematic or serious discrimination may constitute persecution
Assessment_Factor: Incidents of harassment assessed as isolated, lack of systematic evidence of persecution
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of Refugee Division's decision
Review_Standard: Reasonableness of the Refugee Division's decision based on evidence presented
Evidence_Used: Reports of harassment due to religious belief, continued practice of religion, lack of state protection or systemic targeting
Application_Basis: Convention refugee definition based on fear of persecution for reasons of religion
Evidence_Assessed: Incidents of harassment, personal testimony, context of religious discrimination in country of origin
Governing_Rule: Systematic or serious discrimination may constitute persecution; burden of proof on applicant to show objective justification
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of systematic evidence to support claim of persecution
Harm_Assessment: Harassment due to religious identity, but not rising to level of persecution
Cause_Description: Applicant's claim for refugee status was denied by the Refugee Division, prompting judicial review
Evidence_Handling: Judicial review analyzed whether the Refugee Division's evaluation of evidence was reasonable
Evidence_Issues: Isolated incidents not sufficient to establish objective fear
Evidence_Assessment: Incidents found to be isolated and not indicative of state-sponsored or widespread persecution
Decision_Rationale: The applicant failed to meet the burden of proof for objective fear of persecution
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence to demonstrate systematic persecution
Legal_Standard_Applied: Subjective fear and objectively justified fear of persecution under the Refugee Convention
